required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects Of Ertugliflozin (PF-04971729, MK-8835) In Participants With Type 2 Diabetes (MK-8835-040)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, 2-Period, Cross-Over Single Day Evaluation Of The Pharmacokinetic-Pharmacodynamic Effect Of Once And Twice Daily Oral Administration Of PF-04971729 In Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 1 pharmacokinetic, pharmacodynamic study to understand the manner in which the body responds to, as well as how the drug is handled by the body, with once vs twice daily dosing of ertugliflozin (PF-04971729, MK-8835) in participants with type 2 diabetes.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 hours in each dosing period

primary_outcome.measure: Time course of the urinary glucose excretion

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 7 in each dosing period

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Discontinuing Study Drug Due to an AE
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 1 in each dosing period

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC) from time 0 to time of the last quantifiable concentration (AUClast) for ertugliflozin
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 hours in each dosing period
Up to 24 hours in each dosing period

primary_outcome.measure: Time taken to reach the maximum observed plasma concentration (Tmax) of ertugliflozin
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 hours in each dosing period

arm_group.description: Period 1 (AM/PM) dose: E 2 mg/Placebo. Period 2 (AM/PM) dose: E 1 mg /E 1 mg. There was a >= 7 day washout period between Period 1 and Period 2.
Period 1 (AM/PM) dose: E 1 mg/E 1 mg. Period 2 (AM/PM) dose: E 2 mg /Placebo. There was a >= 7 day washout period between Period 1 and Period 2.
Period 1 (AM/PM) dose: E 4 mg/Placebo. Period 2 (AM/PM) dose: E 2 mg /E 2 mg. There was a >= 7 day washout period between Period 1 and Period 2.
Period 1 (AM/PM) dose: E 2 mg/E 2 mg. Period 2 (AM/PM) dose: E 4 mg /Placebo. There was a >= 7 day washout period between Period 1 and Period 2.

intervention.description: Ertugliflozin 2 mg dose (using 1 mg strength tablets), administered as a single dose

intervention.intervention_name: Ertugliflozin 2 mg split into twice daily
intervention.description: Ertugliflozin 1 mg dose (using 1 mg strength tablets) administered twice daily x 1 day
Ertugliflozin 4 mg dose (using 1mg strength tablets), administered as a single dose

intervention.intervention_name: Ertugliflozin 4 mg split into twice daily
intervention.description: Ertugliflozin 2 mg dose (using 1 mg strength tablets) administered twice daily x 1 day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with type 2 diabetes, on up to 2 acceptable oral anti-diabetes drugs for at least 8-weeks prior to study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with type 1 diabetes, patients with stroke, unstable angina, heart attack in last 6-months, uncontrolled blood pressure.
